required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Self Myofascial Release (SMR) and Bioelectrical Activity of Muscles

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to assess the impact of SMR intervention in the hamstring muscles on the activity of the biceps and gluteus muscles.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will cover 40 men, players of amateur football leagues, aged 18 - 40. The test will include the measurement of sEMG of the biceps and gluteal muscles during the exercise, followed by myofascial self-release (SMR). Muscle sEMG was re-measured immediately after roller therapy.

primary_outcome.description: The sEMG examination of the biceps and gluteus muscles will be performed using the MyoTrace 400 recorder by Noraxon USA Inc. with a sampling frequency of 1000 Hz, using the bipolar method, in accordance with SENIAM standards.The bioelectrical activity of the muscles will be tested during the squat.

primary_outcome.measure: Surface electromyography (sEMG) examination immediately after SMR
primary_outcome.description: The change in bioelectrical activity of the biceps and gluteus muscles will be performed. The bioelectrical activity of the muscles will be tested during the squat.

primary_outcome.measure: Surface electromyography (sEMG) examination 5 minutes after SMR
primary_outcome.description: The change in bioelectrical activity of the biceps and gluteus muscles will be performed. The bioelectrical activity of the muscles will be tested during the squat.

arm_group.description: The players of amateur football leagues who will receive SelfMyofascial Release intervention
The players of amateur football leagues who will receive no intervention

intervention.description: Myofascial auto-release consisted of rolling the roller on a group of knee flexors for 3.5 minutes between the sciatic tumor and the knee joint in both directions, omitting the popliteal fossa. Before and after the intervention, sEMG of the biceps and gluteal muscles will be performed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- signing informed consent to participate in the study
- age in the range of 18-40 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- people who had orthopedic injuries to the lower limbs and the lumbar-pelvic-iliac complex in the last year
- people who reported pain in the lower limbs and the lumbar-pelvic-iliac complex on the day of the examination
- people who underwent myofascial therapy in the last 6 weeks
- people with non-specific neuromuscular disorders

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Kinesitherapy and Special Methods, SHS in Katowice, Medical University of Silesia in Katowice, Katowice, Poland

patient_data.ipd_description: The datasets used and / or analyzed in the present study will be available from the respective author upon reasonable request.
